instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: Did anyone figured the common video problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yet?
threads.message:
in recent few days, I got two more <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in.
shoot,  pretty much same problems as the ones I encountered previously and didn't solve.
video issues, sometimes switch to NVIDIA graphics then it freezes, sometimes just distortion. (not like the mux kind color distortion,but like the whole image got twisted or something)
one specific board has no output on the display port, not sure if it's related.

thinking problem should be laying around the video circuit, I actually replaced the GPUs previously but that didn't solve the issue, so thinking on the GPU power circuit now.
can't find any capacitor similar to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>... so really no clues, anyone solved this problem yet?I think it's pretty common, I came across about 5-6 boards these few months of this problem already( this specific model)

thanks

threads.title: Did anyone figured the common video problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yet?
threads.message: I have one here too now. I may look into this in the next weeks. No idea what it is at the moment.

threads.title: Did anyone figured the common video problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yet?
threads.message: sure man, Im working on it too,just no clue so far,let me know if anything,thanks

threads.title: Did anyone figured the common video problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yet?
threads.message: I already replaced GPU and resoldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. I doubt it is the VRAM so not touching that yet. I'm not at work this week, maybe you can look at <CAPACITOR>C8360</CAPACITOR>/1?

threads.title: Did anyone figured the common video problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yet?
threads.message: sure,let me try that and let you know

threads.title: Did anyone figured the common video problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> yet?
threads.message:
just want to update a bit,got sometime today and dealt with <CAPACITOR>C8360</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C8361</CAPACITOR>.
replaced with poly-tant the big one , 330 2.5 , but seems no luck,problem is still there.
